com.epoch.chem

Class VectorMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.chem.VectorMath

  • public class VectorMath
extends Object
    Methods for doing 3D geometry such as calculating dihedral angles or bond angles. The implementation is based on a fairly simple 3D vector representation that provides methods required by dihedral calculation but nothing more.
    This class has a main() method that takes 5 parameters, a molecule string (e.g. smiles) and four atom indices (starting from 0). If the input molecule has no 3d data (e.g. a SMILES is given) the 3D coordinates are calculated. Hydrogens are always added. 
     Usage example: java VectorMath "C1CCCCC1" 1 2 3 4
    The above example calculates the dihedral angle over the bond between atoms 2 and 3 with respect to atoms 1 and 4.

    • Method Detail

      • debugPrint

        private static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

      • calcDihedral

        public double calcDihedral(int[] i,
                           String degOrRadian,
                           int range)
        Calculates and returns the dihedral angle specified by the given atoms. The angle is measured around the bond atoms[1]-atoms[2] with respect to atoms[0] and atoms[3]. Typically, atoms[0] is a neighbor of atoms[1], while atoms[3] is a neighbor of atoms[2].
        The angle calculated is the angle between planes atoms[0] atoms[s[0]] atoms[s[1]] and atoms[1] atoms[2] atoms[3].
        Parameters:
        i - indices of four contiguous atoms; dihedral will be calculated about the bond of the middle two
        degOrRadian - whether to return the value in degrees or radians
        range - whether to return a value between 0 and 180 or 0 and 360
        Returns:
        the dihedral angle

      • calcDihedral

        public double calcDihedral(int[] i,
                           String degOrRadian)
        Calculates and returns the dihedral angle specified by the given atoms. The angle is measured around the bond atoms[1]-atoms[2] with respect to atoms[0] and atoms[3]. Typically, atoms[0] is a neighbor of atoms[1], while atoms[3] is a neighbor of atoms[2].
        The angle calculated is the angle between planes atoms[0] atoms[s[0]] atoms[s[1]] and atoms[1] atoms[2] atoms[3].
        Parameters:
        i - indices of four contiguous atoms; dihedral will be calculated about the bond of the middle two
        degOrRadian - whether to return the value in degrees or radians
        Returns:
        the dihedral angle between 0 and 180

      • calcDihedral

        public double calcDihedral(int[] i,
                           int range)

        The angle calculated is the angle between planes atoms[0] atoms[s[0]] atoms[s[1]] and atoms[1] atoms[2] atoms[3].
        Parameters:
        i - indices of four contiguous atoms; dihedral will be calculated about the bond of the middle two
        range - whether to return a value between 0 and 180 or 0 and 360
        Returns:
        the dihedral angle in degrees

        public static double angle(MolAtom[] atoms)

        Returns:
        the angle between -π and π

      • proj1onPlaneNormalTo2

        public static DPoint3 proj1onPlaneNormalTo2(DPoint3 vector1,
                                            DPoint3 vector2)
        Generates a projection of vector1 on a plane perpendicular to vector2. Both vectors originate at a center. Formula from http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/geometry/elements/plane/lineOnPlane/index.htm
        Parameters:
        vector1 - vector to be projected
        vector2 - plane-defining vector
        Returns:
        the projection

      • pointInRect

        public static boolean pointInRect(DPoint3 p,
                                  MRectangle box)
        Determines if a point is in a box. Algorithm: true if angles between vectors to adjacent corners add up to 360 degrees.
        Parameters:
        p - a point
        box - a rectangle defined by four points
        Returns:
        true if the point is in the box defined by the four points

      • pointInRect

        public static boolean pointInRect(DPoint3 p,
                                  MRectangle box,
                                  double scale)
        Determines if a point is in a box. Algorithm: true if angles between vectors to adjacent corners add up to 360 degrees.
        Parameters:
        p - a point
        box - a rectangle defined by four points
        scale - how much to change the size of the rectangle
        Returns:
        true if the point is in the box defined by the four points

      • pointOnLine

        public static boolean pointOnLine(DPoint3 p,
                                  MPolyline line)
        Determines if a point is on a line. Algorithm: true if angles between vectors to line endpoints add up to 180 degrees.
        Parameters:
        p - a point
        line - a line
        Returns:
        true if the point is on the line

      • pointOnLine

        public static boolean pointOnLine(DPoint3 p,
                                  MPolyline segment,
                                  boolean debugPrint)
        Determines if a point is on a line segment. Algorithm: true if angles between vectors to segment endpoints add up to 180 degrees.
        Parameters:
        p - a point
        segment - a line segment
        debugPrint - whether to debugPrint
        Returns:
        true if the point is on the line segment

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Allows to test the VectorMath class. Takes five parameters, a molecule string and 4 atom indices and output the dihedral angle specified by these four atoms.
        Parameters:
        args - a molecule string and 4 atom indices
